Mod.Name: Moguri Mod
Mod.Author: Ze_PilOt / Snouz
Mod.Description:
Moguri Mod is a rework of FFIX's visuals, helped by AI and polished with love. It's a faithful experience aimed at new players, veterans and nostalgic people alike
- HD backgrounds (faithfully aided by AI, merged and polished by hand) - All 11k layer edges manually redrawn - Overhaul of all model textures - Improved FMVs that merge with backgrounds - HD places names, using original fonts - Rework of some UI elements (maps, minimap, menu...) - HD chocographs (based on Caledor's work with permission) - Visual bugfixes (some by SamsamTS)
Note: 30fps videos and the alternative soundtrack are now separate mods
Mod.PatchNotes: Version 9.0 is a full rework of all aspects with new technologies, especially the backgrounds and battle maps.

Mod.Name: Moguri 30fps videos
Mod.Author: Lykon, Snouz
Mod.Description: This contains 30fps videos (natively 15fps) fluidified by AI. Lykon - rendering, research Snouz - syncronization

Mod.Name: Alternate Fantasy
Mod.Author: Tirlititi
Mod.Description:
This mod aims at increasing the difficulty and, above all, to give a new fresh experience of FF9 for those who already know the game well. It includes: - Many changes in the battle system, the enemies and the abilities - The possibility to recruit Beatrix in the party at a certain point - The re-introduction of a few scenes that were sidelined by the original developpers - A couple of new boss battles...
More informations can be found on the mod's webpage.
Mod.CompatibilityNotes: Keeping Moguri at the lowest priority is surely the best: - ".raw16" and ".raw17" assets are duplicates of the base game's assets in Moguri - Most of the "EventEngine" assets (field event scripts and battle AI) are also duplicates, except a couple of field scripts that don't overlap with Alternate Fantasy's
You must move the Moguri mod to the bottom of the list for a proper installation of Alternate Fantasy

Mod.Name: Beatrix Mod
Mod.Author: Tirlititi
Mod.Description:
Allow the optional recruitment of Beatrix as a permanent character. She must be met in Alexandria once the Hilda Gard III is obtained and before moving to Terra.
This is actually a lighter version of Alternate Fantasy, to benefit from its added content without changing the extensive modifications of the gameplay. Don't use both simultaneously.

Mod.Name: Trance Seek
Mod.Author: DV
Mod.IncompatibleWith: Alternate Fantasy,Amazing Quina,Beatrix Mod,Black Cat - Endgame Shop,David Bowie Edition,Freya Game+,Garnet is Main Character,Play As Kuja,Playable Character Pack,Tantalus
Mod.Description:
A hard mod that allows you to experience a new whole adventure! All the monsters and bosses have been redesigned (not only a stats boost but all the AIs are revisited), new skills, mechanics and many other things!
Currently, Trance Seek is... - A thoughtfully increased difficulty, designed for players seeking challenge. - A complete overhaul of all combat, in terms of stats, AI and skills. - Around 30 new bosses added (including 2 superbosses): all the game's bosses have been reworked to offer different mechanics and more! - The game has a total of 84 SA + 84 additional enhanced versions (WIP). - All characters have 44 SA available (not counting boosted versions, so a total of 88 SA each!). - Each character has its own unique passive or mechanic. +40 new skills added. - 59 new items (WIP) ! - And lots more ^_^
This is not an EXTREME hardcore difficult mod: it only adds a higher difficulty than the original version while keeping a constant progression.
It's currently a demo : CD1 + CD2 + CD3 available but almost +30 hours of gameplay ! Don't hesitate to try!
/_!_\ IMPORTANT /_!_\ Recommended language : Fran√ßais / English (UK) Not supported language : Japanese
Mod.PatchNotes:
- "Break/Up" status now overlapped and scrolled, to make icons clearer in combat (code improved by Tirlititi, thanks to him!!) - "Break/Up" status rework:
‚öîÔ∏è PowerBreak/PowerUp: Increases/Decreases target's physical damage by 10%, cumulative up to 5 times. üßô MagicBreak/MagicUp: Increases/Decreases target's magical damage by 10%, cumulative up to 5 times. üõ°Ô∏è ArmorBreak/ArmorUp: Increases/Decreases target's physical damage received by 10%, cumulative up to 5 times. üß† MentalBreak/MentalUp: Increases/Decreases target's magical damage received by 10%, cumulative up to 5 times.
- [WIP] Stats readjustment for certain characters. - [WIP] New script implemented when a character joins the team: better calculation of these stats (particularly visible for Amarant/Eiko/Beatrix). - [WIP] Steiner can now use Swd Mag on multiple targets! - [WIP] Gravity spells such as Demi now work on strong ennemies like bosses! Against this type of enemy, the spell is much less effective and loses power with each use on the target. The damage is rather interesting at the start of a fight, but the formula will maybe be reworked.
- Fixed a bug where Steiner would fail Vivi's focus passive if using a Swd Mag in multi-targets. - Fixed a bug where Redemption was not taken into account for Beatrix's Seiken under Trance. - Braver and Heroism grant two stacks of PowerUp and MagicUp instead of one. - Plenitude no longer gives MagicUp and MentalUp, but a bonus in Magic and Psy (cumulative). - Old status no longer works on bosses. - Resilience+ SA corrected - Slight correction on the description of SA Doctor and Doctor+. - Corrected a problem with the SA Last Stand. - Mug+ no longer works on itself. - Correction of damage when a spell is cast on multiple targets. - HitRateScript removed from Poison magic attacks (script 0119). - Slight change to SFX for the following items: Phoenix Down and Phoenix Pinion. - Fixed a bug on the CD3 superboss, where a softlock was possible with AutoLife or Last Stand. - Fixed a bug on the CD3 superboss, where a Bio spell was not absorbed under Zombie. - Fixed a bug with two monsters in the Treno arena. - Slight correction to the position of the Brother and Sister swords. - Some changes and improvements to Plant Brain combat. - Slight changes to Ypsen's secret boss. - Slight change to CD3 super boss level. - Correction of various bugs against the Tantarian fight + some changes to the fight. - Correction on Ragtimes combat, where it was possible to answer these 16 questions at CD1. - Fixed a monster's Bio spell that was considered a "Thunder" type attack. - New correction to the "Eat" damage formula. - Fixed a bug on rackets, where elemental absorption was not taken into account. - Corrected a major bug on "Darkside" skills, which no longer worked for monsters. - "HP Absorb" and "MP Absorb" attacks are now subject to elemental affinities. - Correction of some custom .seq files. - "Cleave" .seq file corrected. - "Water" .seq file changed. - Changed stats on some weapons/accessories, as well as skills to learn. - Corrected a major bug on field n¬∞2850 (Hilda Garde 3/Bridge) where the Party Reserve was modified at each init. - Slight correction to Scissor Fangs's description (in French). - New dialogues for Mogster about Trance Seek! - Slight change to a tutorial window at the start of the game, concerning the soft reset. - Correction of dialogues in the Qu's Marsh in the "Spanish" version. - Correction of dialogues on Cinna's store in Prima Vista (all languages except French) - Correction of multiple dialogues in US on the following fields: [352] Dali/Inn => Dali Inn Library + Dali Inn Fortune + Dali Inn Window (spying Garnet) [550] Lindblum/Shopping Area => Woman with white dress. [555] Lindblum/Shopping Area => The Small Town Knight In A Big City ATE
/_!_\ Known bug: Sentinel and Dual commands open the targeting window, unlike previous versions. This will be corrected in the next Memoria update!

Mod.Name: Playable Character Pack
Mod.Author: Tirlititi
Mod.Description: Add Kuja, Fratley and Lani as playable characters. You can press Alt+F2 in-game to access the party menu (changing the party at any time is a feature of Memoria, not related to this mod). You should set the priority of this mod to be higher than the priority of the Moguri mod but lower than other mods.

SubMod.Name: Zidane Pluto outfit
SubMod.Description: When enabled, Zidane's battle model will wear a Pluto armor.

SubMod.Name: Garnet White Mage robe
SubMod.Description: When enabled, Garnet's battle model will wear the traditional White Mage robe.

Mod.Name: Support Ability Cost
Mod.Author: faospark / Tirlititi
Mod.Description:
Allows You to have 1 Gem cost per support ability or Half. [1] 1 Gem Cost is activate by default [2] Half the cost of Support abilities
Mod Order : Position 1 or on top of Any Gameplay mods such as Alternate Fantasy , Playable Character pack. Tantalus Etc This was the earliest public release of this type of Mod that modifies the Gem Cost of Support Abilities Originally released as part of the tweaks of Kupo Mods formerly Mog Add-ons

SubMod.Name: Tweak: Half Cost of Support Abilities
SubMod.Description: Cuts ability gems to half for support abilites

Mod.Name: Exp, AP, Gil , Rewards Tweaks
Mod.Author: faospark
Mod.Description: As the name suggests, this mod has several options that can multiply your Exp, AP , Gil and After Battle Rewards. Mod Order : On top of any Gameplay Mod. Originally released as the tweaks component of Kupo Mods Formerly Mog Add-ons

SubMod.Name: Tweak: Get 2x of any item drop after battle
SubMod.Description: Any item received after battle would be multiplied by 2 , hence if a monster drops 2 potions you get 4

SubMod.Name: Tweak: Get 4x of any item drop after battle
SubMod.Description: Any item received after battle would be multiplied by 4 , hence if a monster drops 2 potions you get 8

Mod.Name: No Exp Plus
Mod.Author: faospark
Mod.Description: If you want some degree of challenge. This mod basically suppresses leveling up in game and more Features: [1] No / Zero AP and EXP Gain After Battle [2] No EXP Gain After Battle BUT GAINS AP [3] Doubled EXP Requirement [4] 8x EXP Requirement This mod was initially introduced as the Exp challenge tweaks within Kupo Mods, previously known as Mog Add-ons.

SubMod.Name: Challenge: No / Zero AP and EXP Gain After Battle
Challenge: No EXP Gain After Battle BUT GAINS AP
SubMod.Description: If you like things hard but still gain MP .

SubMod.Name: Challenge: Doubled EXP Requirement
SubMod.Description: Doubles EXP requirement so you level up slower

SubMod.Name: Challenge: 8x EXP Requirement
SubMod.Description: 8 Times EXP requirement so you almost dont level up

Mod.Name: Kupo Heroes Pack
Mod.Author: faospark
Mod.Description:
A set of Character enhancements that powers up characters and lessens the grind of the game. Perfect for players who wants to experience something new for the characters without altering the flow and story of the game.
== Features == **ALL Characters:** - Adds resistance to Zombie (via Auto-Life) and Virus (via Anti-Body). - Replaces Auto-Potion with a 5% boost to both HP and MP.
**Zidane:** - Gains a new support ability called *Pillage*, which doubles the damage output of *Thievery*, effectively halving its execution time.
**Vivi:** - Gains access to the spells *Aero*, *Quake*, and *Water*, each capable of targeting all enemies and upgradable to their *AGA* versions.
**Steiner:** - Can equip *Save The Queen* and gains access to all of Vivi's new black magic spells.
**Quina:** - The effectiveness of their two primary abilities is enhanced: *Eat* can now be used when an enemy's health is at 75%, and *Cook* can be used at 100% enemy health.
**Freya:** - Gains the *High Jump* support ability, increasing the damage output of *Jump* by threefold.
**Garnet:** - Gains a new spell called *Photon Beam*, a medium-level Holy damage spell available early in the game to increase her effectiveness.
**Amarant:** - Gains the *Tensai* support ability, allowing him to learn abilities eight times faster than other characters, compensating for his late-game recruitment.
**Eiko:** - The summons *Titan* and *Fenrir* are now independent: *Moonstone* grants *Fenrir*, while *Sapphire* grants *Titan*.
**Beatrix:** - Gains all enhancements available in Beatrix mods.
See more on the readme.txt file
Mod Order: above Beatrix and Tantalus mods. not Yet compatible with Alternate fantasy
Part of the Characters Enhancements feature of Kupo Mods Formerly Mog Add-ons

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[All] Add Resistance to Zombie and Virus
SubMod.Description: Auto-life resists Zombie, Anti-body Resists Virus

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[All] Bye Auto-Potion
SubMod.Description: Replace Auto-Potion with HP and MP 5%

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[Eiko] The Summoner
SubMod.Description: Splits Titan and Fenrir as their won independent summon

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[Freya] The Dragoon
SubMod.Description: Make Freya's High Jump do 3x damage

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[Steiner] The Queens Knight
SubMod.Description: Steiner can Equip Save the Queen

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[Vivi] The Warlock
SubMod.Description: Vivi and Steiner can Cast Aero,Quake,Water to RA to AGA spells

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[Garnet] The White Mage
SubMod.Description: Adds A White Magic Ability to Garnet that causes damage

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[Amaranth] The Genius Nomad
SubMod.Description: Amaranth learns the Passive Tensai which makes him Learn and Level UP fast

SubMod.Name: Enhance:[Beatrix] The Paladin
SubMod.Description: Add Basic stat Support for Beatrix based of the Beatrix mod

Mod.Name: Tantalus
Mod.Author: Emeiru
Mod.Description: Overhauls Blank, Cinna, and Marcus to become actually usable characters Includes: - The tantalus trio with their own set of active and supporting abilities - Base stats improvements - Steal-Gil and Mug buffed - New items and tweaks to complement the trio and thief gameplay - Minor name and ability text changes (purely thematic)
Mod.PatchNotes: Complete changes and info can be found on this mod's page.

Mod.Name: Black Cat - Endgame Shop
Mod.Author: Emeiru
Mod.Description:
The Black Mage Village (Disc 4) now sells almost every item in the game! - No. 239's Weapon and Armor Shop now sells every purchasable weapon and armor. - The Black Cat Synthesis Shop now can synthesize all regular equipment.
Complete changes and info can be found on this mod's page.

Mod.Name: Amazing Quina
Mod.Author: Emeiru
Mod.Description: Amazing tweaks and improvement for the quirky Quina Includes: - Forks deal more consistent random damage - New endgame robe for Quina that removes LV spell multiplier - New trance command, Dbl Blu (from Alternate Fantasy) - Quina now learns Scan, Return Magic, and others - Tweaks to abilities like Goblin Punch, White Wind, and more
Mod.PatchNotes: Complete changes and info can be found on this mod's page.

Mod.Name: David Bowie Edition
Mod.Author: Clem Fandango
Mod.Description: Final Fantasy IX: David Bowie Edition (DBE) is a gameplay mod that is meant to function as a rebalance, or better yet a remix of the original game. This mod includes new skills, items, enemy behavior, Chocograph rewards and a number of smaller tweaks.

Mod.Name: Garnet is Main Character
Mod.Author: piano221
Mod.Description: This mod allow you to change Zidane for Garnet as the field main character.

Mod.Name: Freya Game+
Mod.Author: ChikoLad
Mod.Description: Freya Game+ is a Final Fantasy IX mod that allows you to have Freya in your party at almost all times throughout the game. This mod removes the need to do any save editing or setting personal restrictions if you want to do a Freya Solo Run.

Mod.Name: Kupo UI Suite
Mod.Author: faospark
Mod.Description:
The First User Interface Suite for FFIX. This mod allows you to change the ff: Dialogue UI, Menu, Title Screen, Menu Bg , World Map , Title loop , Triple Triad Mat. Also Included Text UI helpers Synthesis menus
== Dialogue / UI == Darker UI (original preset transforms blue to teal and gray to almost black gray) Flat UI for gray and classic choices Darker UI frame from The Pixel Remaster == Title Screen == Recreation || Alternative || Old School == Menu Bg == Black || Tantalus || Chocobo == World Map === Colored Mist Continent and World Map == Title Loop == Complete replacement using enhance concept Art == Triple Triad Mat == Changes the mat of tetra master to triple triad. this will automatically turn on triple triad mode
Default turned on mods : Darker UI + Recreation TS + Colored World Map + default extended of portraits pack and simple psx button [See Recommendations below]
Mod Order : Position one or on top of Any Gameplay mod .
Recommendations Best used with Portrait Mod and Buttons Pack that are also part of The Kupo Mods Umbrella
Originally released as part of Kupo Mods formerly Mog-Addons to see previews and learn more about the mod visit the website url

SubMod.Name: Dialogue Box : Flat
SubMod.Description: Just a Full Solid colors like the old games

SubMod.Name: Dialogue Box : PR Darker UI
SubMod.Description: Pixel Remaster Version of Darker UI

SubMod.Name: Menu Bg : Pure Black
SubMod.Description: Removes the store pattern in Menu Background

SubMod.Name: Title Screen : Alternate
SubMod.Description: Shows an Alternative title screen and Memoria Indicator

SubMod.Name: Title Screen : Recreation
SubMod.Description: Shows a Recreation title screen and Memoria Indicator

SubMod.Name: Title Screen : Old School
SubMod.Description: Shows an old school type of title screen

SubMod.Name: UI : Concept Art Title Loop
SubMod.Description: Replace Title Loop Images with Concept Art

SubMod.Name: UI : Disable Alternate World and Mist Continent Map
UI: Triple Triad Mat
SubMod.Description: Triple triad inspired mat and UI for the Game

Mod.Name: Playstation Sounds
Mod.Author: DV
Mod.Description: Replace the sound assets by the PSX sounds (specially Battle + Tetra Master + Miscellaneous). More than 1540 sound files fixed!
Mod.PatchNotes: Improved "Trance Spear" SFX : se510236, se510237, se510238, se510240, se510241 et se510242 (report by Quetzal and SamsamTS)

Mod.Name: Moguri Alt Soundtrack
Mod.Author: Pontus Hultgren, Ze_PilOt
Mod.Description: Orchestral version for 13 songs, reinterpreted by Pontus Hultgren

Mod.Name: Moguri Mod (2020)
Mod.Author: Ze_PilOt / Snouz
Mod.Description:
This is the old 2020 version of the Moguri backgrounds, but with all the rest (textures, UI, fixes, edge cutting, lights...) from Moguri 9. This version's backgrounds are more pixel-perfect, paint-like, but noisier.
Moguri Mod is a rework of FFIX's visuals, helped by AI and polished with love. It's a faithful experience aimed at new players, veterans and nostalgic people alike
- HD backgrounds (faithfully aided by AI, merged and polished by hand) - All 11k layer edges manually redrawn - Overhaul of all model textures - Improved FMVs that merge with backgrounds - HD places names, using original fonts - Rework of some UI elements (maps, minimap, menu...) - HD chocographs (based on Caledor's work with permission) - Visual bugfixes (some by SamsamTS)
Note: 30fps videos and the alternative soundtrack are now separate mods
Mod.PatchNotes: Version 8.4 has the same backgrounds as 8.3, but with some redone layer edges, lights, new battle textures, UI elements, NPC, bugfixes...

Mod.Name: PSX Buttons
Mod.Author: gdi
Mod.Description: Use the Playstation button icons instead of the Xbox button icons.

Mod.Name: Kupo Controller Pack
Mod.Author: faospark
Mod.Description:
The original COMPLETE controller buttons pack of FF9. Available Themes: - PlayStation Vanilla prompts [On by default] the closest to the game stock UI, Turned on by Default - (Dualshock 4) PlayStation Gloss prompts a glossier type and default install - (Dualsense) PS5 white button prompts Black and White look of PS5 - Pixel Type Button Prompts if you want it old School - SNES North American one [via request] Because we can.
A component of Kupo Library formerly Mog Add-ons

SubMod.Name: Buttons : PS Vanilla (PSX)
SubMod.Description: PS prompts in the same Style as the default xbox prompts

SubMod.Name: Buttons : Pixels (PSX)
SubMod.Description: Pixelated Prompts if that is your thing

SubMod.Name: Buttons : SNES
SubMod.Description: A Requested SNES or Switch layout

Mod.Name: Dualsense Buttons
Mod.Author: SamsamTS
Mod.Description: Replace Xbox buttons with the Playstation Dualsense buttons.

Mod.Name: Switch Buttons
Mod.Author: SamsamTS
Mod.Description: Replace Xbox buttons with the Nintendo Switch buttons.

Mod.Name: High-Res Chocographs
Mod.Author: Caledor
Mod.Description: [Already integrated in Moguri 9.0] Chocographs remade from scratch by taking actual screenshots in FF9 Steam modded with Moguri Mod 8.2.

Mod.Name: Tweaked Portraits
Mod.Author: Lykon
Mod.Description: This is a simple mod that slightly tweaks the portrait shown in the main menu.

Mod.Name: Portraits Pack
Mod.Author: faospark
Mod.Description: The Original Portraits Pack, part of the Kupo Mods, formerly Mog Add-ons. To DFFOO fans this is where the DFFOO portraits resides All presets contain portrait support for Kuja, Fratley , Lani and even some planned characters to be added. Available Presets: [1] Default Extended : contains a nodded version of the default portraits with enhanced Marcus, Cinna etc. on by default [2] Opera Omnia Portraits : contains Dissidia Final Fantasy Opera Omnia portraits [2.1] Opera Omnia Portraits : contains DFFOO Pluto Knight / White Mage [3] PSX Upscaled : waifu2x Upscaled psx versions Mod Order : Must be Place Above the mods mentioned above Playable Character Pack , Beatrix Mod , Tantalus mod and Kupo UI Suite.

SubMod.Name: Portraits : Default Extended Cast
SubMod.Description: Default Portraits that includes Kuja, Fratly and Lani [on by Default]

SubMod.Name: Portraits : DFFOO Pluto Knight / White Mage
SubMod.Description: DFFOO Style for Extra costumes for Zidane and Garnet, must be used with the Opera Omnia portraits

SubMod.Name: Portraits : PSX Upscaled
SubMod.Description: original psx release Upscaled using waifu2x and Gigapixel

Mod.Name: No Cutscene
Mod.Author: Tirlititi
Mod.Description: Removes most of cutscenes from the game for speedrunning purpose.

Mod.Name: Triple Triad
Mod.Author: DV
Mod.Description: Change the music and background to the Triple Triad FF8 version (based on Tripod !) Change some card textures (add boss + characters)

Mod.Name: Better Card Drops
Mod.Author: DV

SubMod.Name: RandomCard
SubMod.Description: Drop a random card at each battle !

Mod.Description: Get the matching card from mobs/bosses ! You can use different options to modify the drop rate. Idea by Snouz and made by DV.
Mod.PatchNotes: - Add a thumbnail (thank you Faospark ! :D) - Merge RandomCard options from Mog Add-ons to BetterCardDrop (by Faospark)

Mod.Name: Brazilian-Portuguese Translation
Mod.Author: Harleyquinn / dkPsycho / JonasJTG
Mod.Description:
Tradu√ß√£o totalmente revisada e atualizada para ser usada somente com o Mod Moguri. O jogo est√° completamente traduzido, incluindo hist√≥ria principal, di√°logos secund√°rios, sidequests, informa√ß√µes e outras coisas.
Informa√ß√µes Importantes - N√£o foram traduzidos os nomes dos Itens, equipamentos e magias. Fiz essa escolha para melhor experi√™ncia dos veteranos e iniciantes. - Ao baixar a tradu√ß√£o existe duas op√ß√µes na pasta de instala√ß√£o: 30 FPS e 60 FPS. Instale somente a vers√£o correspondente que queira usar. - Alguns mods s√£o imcompat√≠veis com a tradu√ß√£o pois susbstituem os arquivos de texto ou de textura. Ent√£o verifique bem antes de instala-los. - Para jogar a vers√£o 60 FPS basta baixar e executar a √∫tima vers√£o do Memoria, encontrada aqui: (https://github.com/Albeoris/Memoria/releases/tag/v2023.06.11)
Para ver o tutorial de como instalar a tradu√ß√£o e acompanhar atualiza√ß√µes e conte√∫dos de FFIX entrem no meu canal. (https://www.youtube.com/@dkpsycho/videos)
